content: <@1276367808778862624> Gonna try to find a source that is not X for situation in Missouri.  One moment...
Since when have states allowed you to print out your own ballots?
Thank you for taking the charge
I am not finding anything to support the print your own ballot issue. Also, we have to be careful about sources we post, speaking as a mod, X is not one.
I removed the X thread, because anything regarding voting issues or details, we have to be careful of sources. Verified news, dot gov sites and a few orgs although those we have to vet closely.
Thanks, I got side tracked a bit. Here's an example of an allowed source as it is a state run site. https://www.mo.gov/government/elections-and-voting.  You can do the same for MT or any other state.
You think there are any other states that allow this?  Literally never thought this was a thing

My opinion at this point is that we cannot verify the source on X, and I have not found any news sites that report problems of this type in MO or anywhere else, so I am dubious.  Therefore, just share the official sources and treat the rest as noise.  Of course, if there is an issue, we have legal groups and voter protection groups to address whatever really exists.

Here's an example of an allowable site, as an official site of the US Govt  Share America dot gov.  It talks about ballots in other languages, but at no point does it say those can be printed by the voter. Of course, that would be a great risk. https://share.america.gov/ballot-in-your-own-language/
Another example could be the Secretary of State, or the states official site
Yes, that too. I found Share America more universal though for general news, because language inclusivity is important. One of the many things we do not want to lose in our democracy.
They are used for overseas voting

That is FVAP dot gov - official US govt site (so it is permitted - mod side note). They help anyone vote who is living overseas, including dual citizens, even those who have never resided in the US but still retain their citizenship. The never resided in the US only applies to some states apparently, Regardless, we need every vote.  https://www.fvap.gov/citizen-voter
Changed the channel name: General Voting Resources - Dot Gov Sites
